intro: Priestleya humilis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a short, stocky stem with narrow, grass-like leaves. Priestleya humilis is often found in desertscrub habitats and is known for its ability to bloom in the spring.
